intro: Restio pillansii, commonly known as the Pillans' restio, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Restionaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, spike-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in coastal regions, preferring sandy or rocky soils. It produces small white or pale blue flowers, which are clustered at the tips of its stems. Restio pillansii is often found in coastal dunes and is adapted to withstand saline and windy conditions.
